page.title: 07Changes in Linlithgow.
page.content: Work in Linlithgow has diminished over the years with Spences and other tanneries closing down just after World War II.The closing of the glue factory,shoe factories,breweries and quite recently the paper mill has resulted in only a very small percentage of Linlithgow's population being employed in the town.Linlithgow is now a commuter town.Its road and rail links provide easy access to main towns. Communications in Linlithgow have not changed much over the years.The motorway has taken the heaviest traffic from the town but has had an adverse effect on trade.Train services have become less frequent since the war. Changes in Linlithgow over the years have resulted in the town losing much of its spirit.
